result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Kennedy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety.  No contact with C.K. unless approved by agent.

SAFE Program. 

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Kennedy

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Becky.
Case called: 8:56 am
State appears by ADA M Puerner.  Def appears pro se

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

PLEA: 
Ct 1 (DC/DA)>>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self: a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH - 1 year probation  CONDITIONS:  SAFE Program; AODA & follow up; Absolute Sobriety; any counseling deemd appropriate by agent; GFE to maintain FTW/school; no contact with C.K. unless approved by agent; CC; DA Surcharge; DNA sample & surcharge

COURT notes no jail credit if revoked

Adj: 9:05 am

Pre-trial conference at 08-20-2015 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 09-08-2015 08:50 am.
Jury Trial at 09-22-2015 08:30 am.

No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  No contact with victim(s):  C.K.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
